results.name: Rows of triangular table A280499 read in reverse order.
comment: This is GF(2)[X] analog of A127013, using "carryless division in base-2" instead of ordinary division.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8256; the first 128 rows of triangle
Index entries for sequences operating on polynomials in ring GF(2)[X]
example: The first 17 rows of the triangle:
program: (Scheme) (define (A280494 n) (A280500bi (A002024 n) (A004736 n))) ;; Code for A280500bi given in A280500.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 09 2017
